basics.name: Mahbub Murshed
basics.label: Technical Lead @ Microsoft
basics.summary:
I co-founded media website Sachalayatan.com in 2006, which won the digital innovation award 2011 by the ministry of science and ICT, Bangladesh. At Expedia, I managed a team of four engineers for the lodging data platform. Currently, I am managing the connector certification portal for Microsoft Power Platform group.
I live in the greater Seattle area with my wife and a boy. I play guitar and photograph the nature. I am a biker and avid reader of all things non-fiction.

highlights: Managing one engineer to develop connector certification portal.
Leading the power platform connector open source effort using Python CLI, Azure Pipelines, and Flow, PowerApps, and LogicApps.
Managed a team of four engineers to build a big data (8 TB) streaming data pipeline for Data Lake using Apache Spark, Kafka, S3, Qubole, and Teradata in Scala, and Java and on AWS.
Modeled the Expedia lodging partner data for thousands of partners in Neo4J GraphDB, Amazon RDS, and Amazon Neptune to compare the three.

work.summary: Developer of an e-Discovery solution for managing large volumes of evidence during litigation.
highlights: Managed a team of two engineers to develop a search engine for 45 TB of audit logs in Elasticsearch in Azure using C#.
Managed a team of three engineers for SonarQube.

work.summary: Ansys is a fortune 500 company that developes Engineering simulation software.
highlights: Led Teamcenter, NX, Solid Edge and other plugins in C#, C++, Python, Javascript.

work.summary: Sachalayatan is a blogging platform and media organization for Bengali speakers.
highlights: Co-founded a media website based on Drupal 6, custom modules, and theme in PHP 5.3, MySQL, NGINX on Debian.
Architected the system using AWS CloudFront, Memcache, Varnish, APC PHP Cache, MySQL, PHP Module for improved performance.
Developed a CAD software in C++ for a redesign problem.
Designed the functionalities for release 2.5 as part of the C++ team.

education.institution: Bangladesh University of Engineering & Technology, Dhaka, Bangladesh

publications.name: Neutral Definition and Recognition of Assembly Features
OAM+: An Assembly Data Model for Legacy Systems Engineering
